description: Actress Scarlett Johansson says tech company OpenAI has created a robot voice far too close to her own without permission. Johansson says one of the voices on OpenAI's new chatbot is "eerily similar" to her own. OpenAI's co-founder says the company has paused the use of the voice but denies copying Johansson's. NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.
title: Scarlett Johansson accuses OpenAI of creating a voice similar to hers without permission

description: Sean “Diddy” Combs’ apology for the 2016 beating of his ex-girlfriend Cassie is falling short among domestic violence groups — and on the internet.
title: Sean Combs apology falls short for many Black women, who face higher rates of domestic violence

description: The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development halted its health and safety inspections of public housing for about two weeks because of a technical failure.
title: U.S. halted safety inspections of public housing for weeks after IT failure

description: Artificial intelligence startup Scale AI said Tuesday that it has raised $1 billion in a Series F funding round that values the enterprise tech company at $13.8 billion — almost double its last reported valuation.
title: Amazon, Meta back Scale AI in $1 billion funding deal that values firm at $14 billion

description: Cyberattacks against water utilities across the country are becoming more frequent and more severe, the Environmental Protection Agency warned Monday.
title: U.S. says cyberattacks against water supplies are rising, and utilities need to do more to stop them

description: Shares of Trump Media fell more than 10% on Tuesday, a day after the Truth Social app owner reported a net loss of $327.6 million on just $770,500 in revenue in the first quarter of 2024.
title: Trump Media stock falls 10% after posting $327.6 million loss in first quarter

description: SAG-AFTRA, the union that represents Hollywood actors, commended Scarlett Johansson for calling out OpenAI for using a voice that sounded "eerily similar" to hers.
title: SAG-AFTRA applauds Scarlett Johansson for rebuking OpenAI over voice that sounded like her

description: Scarlett Johansson is accusing the parent company of OpenAI for using a likeness of her voice without her permission. Johansson says she refused a request to voice the companies’ virtual assistant, Sky, and was “shocked, angered and in disbelief” when she later heard how it sounds. NBC’s Kaylee Hartung reports for TODAY.
title: Scarlett Johansson says OpenAI used her voice without permission

description: Iran began funeral processions in Tabriz on Tuesday for President Ebrahim Raisi after he was killed in a helicopter crash.
title: Iran begins funerals for president after helicopter crash

description: Neuralink will implant a second patient with a brain chip despite some initial issues with the first one. This time the quarter-sized chip will be implanted deeper to prevent it from retracting. Dr. Akshay Syal talks with NBC's Gadi Schwartz about how the procedure works.
title: FDA allows Neuralink to implant second patient with brain chip
